bill.title: Board of Tax Appeals; revise certain provisions regarding appeal of orders by.
bill.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-77-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Taxpayer Appealing An Order Of The Board Of Tax Appeals To Chancery Court Shall Not Be Required To Provide A Bond Unless Deemed Absolutely Necessary By The Chancery Court; To Provide That Any Bond Required By The Chancery Court Shall Be An Appearance Bond Or Performance Bond And That The Court Shall Not Require Any Surety Bond; To Provide That The Burden Of Proof In The Chancery Court Is Always On The Department Of Revenue; To Provide That If An Aggrieved Taxpayer Prevails On Such An Appeal, The Taxpayer Is Entitled To Attorney's Fees, Interest, And Any Other Remedy Deemed Proper By The Chancery Court And That Such Fees Shall Be Collected Against The Agency Or The Commissioner In His Individual And Personal Capacity; And For Related Purposes.
